channel.title: Infiltration Development
channel.description: If you're one of the many who feel the need to create an Infiltration-specific map, texture pack, mutator, or any other development-related elements, stop by. Get and give help, advice, tips, and moral support!

item.title: M16A2 weapon model "mod" (question)
item.author: invalid@example.com (Psychomorph)
item.dc:creator: Psychomorph
item.content:encoded:
Snakeye once modded the original AKMSU model to have an AK74U magazine.

I'd like to try myself in doing a similar thing with the M16A2 model. I want to keep the animations and texture, but improve the original model a bit. Is it a possibility? Can I use a free program like Blender for it?

If possible, how do I start and what do I need to know?

item.title: HUD "mod" (question)
item.author: invalid@example.com (Psychomorph)
item.dc:creator: Psychomorph
item.content:encoded:
In INF you can change the HUD colour and transparency. That means you can also make it just invisible, but if the HUD is still activated, than you have the weapon name, rate of fire and ammo count still displayed.

Is there a way to remove pieces of it, say, the weapon name, and just keep the ROF and ammo count?

Or otherwise would there be a way to make them all transparent (right now they are opaque white)?

item.title: Night Vision Goggles "mod"
item.author: invalid@example.com (Psychomorph)
item.dc:creator: Psychomorph
item.content:encoded:
The NVG's use a texture overlay and Psytex modded it. I used a 16:10 monitor when I made the textures. I have a 16:9 monitor now and ironically mostly run INF in 4:3. That means that the NVG overlay never looks right and changing the texture in the NVG file will give you a version mismatch.

So is there a way to apply another overlay somehow without mismatches? Perhaps it is possible to make a new version of the NVG's that contain 3 overlays for each aspect ratio type (if someones runs ultra...

Night Vision Goggles "mod"

item.title: New carry position
item.author: invalid@example.com (Psychomorph)
item.dc:creator: Psychomorph
item.content:encoded:
I'd love to have this one feature, where the hipped weapon is locked in the lowest free-aim position, with free-aim off, so the mouse look behaves traditionally.

Reloading and of course aiming would reactivate the free-aim, but as soon as you have it carried at hip, the gun moves all the way down, locks and free-aim goes off. Also shooting the hipped weapon would make it aim and fire.

If the "weapon moves down" is not possible, than having it normally centered would do it, too. Most...

New carry position

item.title: 2.86 free-aim to 2.9?
item.author: invalid@example.com (Psychomorph)
item.dc:creator: Psychomorph
item.content:encoded:
I launched up 2.86 and realized how much better the free-aim in 2.86 was and remembered how much I actually always disliked the 2.9 free-aim.

So is there some file or .ini from the 2.86 install that I can put in 2.9 and have the same free-aim?

item.title: Aimed Weapons
item.author: invalid@example.com (Psychomorph)
item.dc:creator: Psychomorph
item.content:encoded:
We have an aimed pistols mutator. I'd like to have it expanded to all weapons, not only for when selected, but after reloading, too.

Is there a simple expand on the aimed pistols mutator possible like this?

item.title: Some questions related to INF and UED
item.author: invalid@example.com (AullidoSepulcral)
item.dc:creator: AullidoSepulcral
item.content:encoded:
First of all, I'd like to greet all members of the (now almost non-existant) INF community, who helped produce one of the most refined and well executed fps experiences ever made. I know the basics of mapping and I'm constantly learning (no real maps as of yet, just experiments). Also note that I use the 2.9 community installer and UT99 v436, and all the main packages are where the installer placed them, on a subfolder inside the ut folder called infiltration that is ordered just like the ut...

Some questions related to INF and UED

item.title: Adding new gametype to the ingame server browser.
item.author: invalid@example.com (Ocsi88)
item.dc:creator: Ocsi88
item.content:encoded:
Hello

Add this to the infiltration.ini for see the Inf unreal coop servers in Infiltration All category:

Add to the [INF_Browser_ALL_INF]
ListFactories[2]=INF_Browser.INF_BrowserSubsetFact,SupersetTag=INF_Browser_All_UT,GameType=INFCoopUnrealGame,bCompatibleServersOnly=True

!!! I set that as [2], because it didn't work as [10] ;(, so watch the numbers!

Add this to the infiltration.ini for...

Adding new gametype to the ingame server browser.

item.title: New Beta of Infiltration 2.75 Extended edition
item.author: invalid@example.com (Silver_Ibex)
item.dc:creator: Silver_Ibex
item.content:encoded:
New Infiltration 2.75 Extended edition

This is a fan made extended edition of the classic Infiltration 2.75 weapon mod, with lots of new enhancements to improve the look and feel of the game play.

Download it here

New enhancements for this edition include
· Improved rifle ghost sight textures
· Animated pistol ghost sight
· Fixed AT4 reload and sight
· Added new weapon AK47 rifle and ammo (see...

New Beta of Infiltration 2.75 Extended edition

item.title: INF 2.75
item.author: invalid@example.com (oZ INF DM)
item.dc:creator: oZ INF DM
item.content:encoded: Is anyone aware of a source code that exists for this old mod Infiltration 2.75? Possibly would like to find a way to remove the player specific reload feature so you dont need the mod installed for the guns to auto reload and would like to remove the recoil as well?

item.title: unreal 1 INF to ut99
item.author: invalid@example.com (oZ INF DM)
item.dc:creator: oZ INF DM
item.content:encoded: how about the original INF mod, non 2.9 to ut99?

item.title: UT 2k3/2k4 RainbowSix mute would like some testers
item.author: invalid@example.com (meowcat)
item.dc:creator: meowcat
item.content:encoded:
UT 2k3/2k4 RainbowSix mute would like some testers [Version 130 29 May 2013]

I have put together a little mutator/mod (~50 Mb download) based on the original Rainbow Six[EDIT now it has a CODMW knockoff mutator, INF 2.75 style mutator, some parkour type player movement and an odd assortment of Turok/Half-life/Halo bullet type weapons too], for UT2k3 and UT2k4. It includes all of the weapons from R6 and the eagle watch pack as well as operative uniforms and models(in all of their low...

UT 2k3/2k4 RainbowSix mute would like some testers

item.title: Mutator: Inf Weapon Enhancement
item.author: invalid@example.com (Crowze)
item.dc:creator: Crowze
item.content:encoded:
This mutator is a collection of small tweaks to Infiltration's weapons, both base and bonus, to make them handle more realistically. It also has a 'RealTargets' mode which currently makes the shotguns more effective, to compensate for the smaller hitbox. A full list of changes is both in the readme and right after the links:
Webpage /...

Mutator: Inf Weapon Enhancement

item.title: DM-GreenlandEnhanced
item.author: invalid@example.com (TerOmen)
item.dc:creator: TerOmen
item.content:encoded: Been working on porting an old map. Here's some comparison shots. First one is the old map, second one is with the new textures.

item.title: String comparison in a mutator?
item.author: invalid@example.com (The Great Sephiroth)
item.dc:creator: The Great Sephiroth
item.content:encoded:
I am working on a mutator for Inf 2.9 CE that will tweak the bots a bit, such as not being able to see through tree textures that we cannot see through. A few maps are currently nearly impossible to win if bots are your opponents due to so much foliage that humans cannot see bots, but bots can see humans anywhere.

Part of my code needs to do a string comparison when compiled in debug mode and I cannot figure out how to do it in UT99. I used a function that Wormbo created some time ago,...

String comparison in a mutator?

item.title: INF_AimedPistols2
item.author: invalid@example.com (Carpetsmoker)
item.dc:creator: Carpetsmoker
item.content:encoded:
Download it:
http://carpetsmoker.net/infiltration/INF_AimedPistols2-1.1.tar.gz

Slightly updated version of INF_AimedPistols by Beppo.

What has changed:
o A new configuration option was added:
bEnabled=True
You can set this to 'False' to disable AimedPistols.

o Package renamed to avoid conflicts.

=========================================
The original description by Beppo (Rescued from google cache):

So, this mutator allows you to...

INF_AimedPistols2

item.title: Jog hold key
item.author: invalid@example.com (Psychomorph)
item.dc:creator: Psychomorph
item.content:encoded: In INF you start out with walk and toggle to jog (and back to walk). Is there a way to have a jog hold key, so you start with walk and keep the movement key pressed to jog (and walk again on release)?

item.title: Freeaim mouse sensitivity
item.author: invalid@example.com (Psychomorph)
item.dc:creator: Psychomorph
item.content:encoded:
Is there a trick to reduce the freeaim sensitivity? It seems higher than the turning speed. For me it is either the turning speed is right but the sights over sensitive and jumpy (can't aim well), or the sights are very well controlable but the turning speed is too slow.
Right now I have to move the mouse across the whole pad to turn around (40cm width of pad) only so I can have good aim. In-acceptable kind of, but I've been battling this problem for most of my INF gaming time.

item.title: Merging used magazins
item.author: invalid@example.com (Coop-Stogie)
item.dc:creator: Coop-Stogie
item.content:encoded: After playing Firearms 3.0 a while ago, i was wondering why INF doesn´t have the "merging used magazin" function. Tried to figure out how to do this, but maybe i´m already too old to understand UT modding. But what ya think about this idea anyway ? i would add the function in the QA menu in the same submenu where you apply bandages

item.title: A new version
item.author: invalid@example.com (Psychomorph)
item.dc:creator: Psychomorph
item.content:encoded:
I think it's time to make one. We'd need Sentry Studios permission for that, but I think Beppo is showing up from time to time, maybe hes permission is suffice enough.

What I have in mind:
1) The basic 2.9 version and the 2.9 Bonus Pack, with the weapon pack 1.5 integrated, but patched to psytex.

2) Original camos and faces removed and psytex camos and faces used instead. I don't mean to disregard the original camos and faces, but psytex was meant to be a facelift and...

A new version
